newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank, Trend Micro to sell virus system in Japan.
newsitem.headline: Softbank, Trend Micro to sell virus system in Japan.

text.p: Softbank Corp and its affiliate Trend Micro Inc said on Monday they will launch a new system in Japan in May to provide companies with protection against computer viruses while using the Internet.
Trend Micro, which is 35 percent owned by Softbank, will provide software and services to systems integrators, who will in turn offer them to their customers.
Softbank will act as a coordinator of the project, the two firms said.
So far, 14 systems integrators, such as Electronic Data Systems Corp's Japanese unit and NTT Data Corp, have agreed to the system, called Vaccine Bank, they said.
Softbank and Trend Micro, an anti-virus software firm, hope to increase that to 30 by the end of this year, the two said.
Systems integrators build computer networks and provide various other computer functions for companies.
The two firms said they are aiming for sales of 1.5 billion yen to 1.6 billion yen by the end of the year.
